data.name: Alice
data.text: 为何同胚保持测度不变

data.name: Alice
data.text: Re 洞主: 那可为什么m(f(K,x))有限

post.text:
#Measure Theory
Let (X,τ) be a topological space and let Ω be the σ-algebra generated by τ. Let m be a Borel measure on X.
Next, let f:X×X→X be a continuous map such that for each  a in X, the map f(·,a): X→X is a homeomorphism.
Also, let K∈Ω be a Borel set with m(K) being finite.
Now we have a function f_K: X→R,  x→m(f(K,x)).
Determine whether f_K is continuous.
